definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: The cunning thief stole the money out of the man's pocket.
sentences.chinese: 狡滑的小偷從那位男士的口袋裏偷了錢。

sentences.english: After they moved the bag away, the girls let the traffic go again.
sentences.chinese: 等他們把口袋搬開以後，姑娘們再讓車輛通行。

sentences.english: A slight, metallic sound, as of coins rattling in a pocket.
sentences.chinese: 叮鐺聲一種象口袋中硬幣碰撞發出輕微。

sentences.english: Check out Buck's selection of tapered and pocket sharpeners.
sentences.chinese: 購買巴克精選的錐形磨刀器和口袋磨刀器。

sentences.english: I bought three cans of Alpo and stuffed them into my leather coat.
sentences.chinese: 我買了3罐狗食，塞進了皮衣口袋。

sentences.english: "Sure, buddy, " says the plebe, rooting around his pocket.
sentences.chinese: “當然，夥計”，新生說着，翻着自己的口袋。

sentences.english: E. g. : The thief was caught red-handed just as he was putting the watch in his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 當小偷把表放進口袋裏時，他被當場抓住了。

sentences.english: Blindy felt it before he put it in his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 盲漢摸了摸硬幣，然後放進口袋。

sentences.english: A number of papers protruded from his pocket .
sentences.chinese: 幾份文件從他口袋裏漏出來。

sentences.english: You take the haversack, I'll search his pockets.
sentences.chinese: 你把乾糧袋撿起來，我來搜他的口袋。

sentences.english: Then he slipped it back into his pocket.
I stuck the paper back in his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 我把紙裝在他的口袋裏。

sentences.english: When he had said it , he took a culminating pinch of Snuff , and put his box in his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 說完他嗅了最後一撮鼻菸，然後把鼻菸盒塞進了口袋。

sentences.english: Too much money ends up in crooked officials' pockets.
sentences.chinese: 太多錢進了奸猾的官員的口袋。

sentences.english: He emptied his pockets out,and we knew that he had no money.
sentences.chinese: 他把他口袋掏空，我們知道他沒有錢。

definition: waist purse (old)/(fig.) purse/pocket/waist pack/fanny pack/bum bag
embroidered pouch for carrying loose change etc/purse/pocket (in clothing)
full and bulging (of a pocket, pouch etc)
